pageContext.description: Found in 2 pieces, head missing, no ornamentation.
pageContext.publications: Cumb. + West A + A Soc. Trans. N.S. xlvii, 73 (main piece of 3 13/16" only) il.
pageContext.site: England,Lancashire,Walney Island, Barrow-in-Furness,North End flint chipping site. Main piece found 1947, tip found 1948, head missing. Found on scoriae of an old iron bloomery in sand dunes, but presence of (?) Bronze Age pottery shards among the slag suggests that the bloomery (? Viking or Monastic) had disturbed earlier deposits which are numerous in immediate vicinity. Pin has been classed L.B.A.
pageContext.toSearch: Walney Island, Barrow-in-furness, Barrow-in-furness, Cumbria La14, UK
pageContext.remarks: From a rich sandhill site yielding specimens from secondary neolithic flints and pots to shards of C12 pottery.
